author: ccadminteam
title: CCv3: Sustaining the Circle
description: El Círculo Catalizador cumple una valiosa función comunitaria, pero no puede sostenerse sobre una base de voluntariado

f6_assessments.q0: The circle is an active part of the Catalyst Community that develops and networks throughout the whole community and manages quite a lot of different tasks that are relevant for all of us. I have had lots of interactions, where circle members connected, informed and provided opportunities for me as a Catalyst member to be active and to take part in all things that concern Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: Yes, the circle is an already working group of community members and this proposal asks for continuous funding to reward the many hours the circle members put into the tasks. Budget breakdown and roadmap is realistic and humble and the circle has proven to provide relevant experience and work for our community.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability is high, repositories and transparency is high and all community members have access to what the circle is planning. Roadmap and budget is auditable which supports trust within the community. The iteration of the circle also helps with trust and acceptance of the circle within the community.

f6_assessments.q0:
Problem statement is clearly articulated: "The Catalyst Circle fulfills a valuable community role but it cannot be sustained on a volunteer basis".

So is the solution: "Funding via Catalyst to ensure ongoing participation and to increase accountability of CC members to the community."

This is very much needed and brings clear added value into the ecosystem (with minimal funding).
f6_assessments.q1: This is a "common good proposal" and as such very much fundable. The plan outlines the responsibilities and outcomes of the Circle and does a good job summarizing everything. Maybe it's intentional (because Catalyst Circle V2 is so fresh) but the "Accomplishments of Catalyst Circle version 2" only states "List accomplishments here". Seems like someone forgot to do the final update.
f6_assessments.q2: Now this is a way to write proposals! Everything is laid out in a clear and consise manner. Easy to track and audit.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about funding via Catalyst to ensure ongoing participation and to increase the accountability of CC members to the community. This is a great and meaningful idea. The Catalyst Circle plays an important role the Cardano's Governance as a whole. The problem is clearly described, and explained in detail. The solution is clearly defined showing a clear impact on the Cardano ecosystem in long term. Therefore, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge, and can rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1: Proof of feasibility from the team profile can be seen, but it is hard to verify [because there is no external link]. The budget is provided with a clear items structure, but without explanations of the calculation base. Risk is not defined. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2:
For better understanding, the team profile should be described in detail with reference/proof (documents/links,...) for verifying. Anh risk should be analyzed.
Based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 3

f6_assessments.q0: Catalyst Circle is a rapidly developing, iterative self-governance tool for the Cardano treasury, acting as a problem-sensing array for the community.  It has been known for a while now that it has been running at a deficit as it gets established, so funding and incentives are definitely required if community members are going to continue to step-up and put in the time and work to create cohesive perspectives of the overwhelming amount of information that composes Project Catalyst.  Whether one agrees with any particular iteration of CCvX, the purpose of this proposal is to better calibrate the incentives for the process, which is information that informs newer, more desirable or effective iterations.
f6_assessments.q1: While this is a difficult proposal to assess metrics on, the team helpfully supplied KPIs (problems sensed/solved) that can help to build an effectiveness ratio for CCv3 and beyond.  The milestones provided, scheduled meetings and feedback sessions are clear enough, but the biggest issue facing CCv3 will be working through a backlog of problems already identified, even as more arise.  To this end the proposal budget seeks to incentivize approx 48hrs worth of  member time in executing CCv3 over the next 3 months.  This budget dilutes if further meetings or other facilitation  are required, or if other participants, such as secretaries are brought onboard.  Compared to the previous budget (which ran at a deficit) this one does not swing too far, and still looks to be targeting a "minimum functional group" approach.
f6_assessments.q2: Through the first part of this process the team reworked and recalibrated the community advisor process, including rewards, and it was done in an open, transparent way and its results communicated to several different platforms.  The scope of Catalyst, and the infancy of this particular aspect means information can slip through the cracks, but other funded Catalyst proposals, such as QA-DAO, are adding their value to the symphonic increase in persistent knowledge within the Catalyst project.  Since the main deliverable will be the bi-weekly meetings and any "lessons learned" documents they create, and since these will all be public, the community should be able to follow along closely as the CCv3 project unfolds.  A suggestion for clarity and transparency:  a dedicated channel of communication under the header of problems sensed/solutions pending(and/or delivered).  This could be a gitbook entry or a dedicated page, and would link to "tip of the iceberg" resources for discussion/understanding.

solution: Financiación a través de Catalyst para garantizar la participación continua y aumentar la responsabilidad de los miembros del CC ante la comunidad.
experience: Somos miembros elegidos de la comunidad de Project Catalyst de sectores clave del ecosistema para identificar y resolver intereses mutuos.
